headline: Tesla Deliveries Should Be Weak. Will It Matter to the Stock?
summary: Tesla is due to report fourth-quarter deliveries on Friday. A company-compiled consensus of 20 brokers predicts deliveries of 422,850 vehicles, down from about 496,000 in the fourth quarter of 2024.

content.title: Tesla Deliveries Should Be Weak. Will It Matter to the Stock?
content.summary: Tesla is due to report fourth-quarter deliveries on Friday. A company-compiled consensus of 20 brokers predicts deliveries of 422,850 vehicles, down from about 496,000 in the fourth quarter of 2024.

headline: Famed Investor Michael Burry Says He’s Not Short Tesla Shares
summary: “I am not short,” Burry said in response to a user on X who asked if he would bet against Tesla.  The renowned investor earned his reputation for predicting the collapse of the US housing market before the 2008 financial crisis.  Since slumping in April, when Elon Musk’s political antics sparked fears that his interest in running the carmaker may be waning, Tesla shares have staged a spectacular turnaround and are near an all-time high.

content.title: Famed Investor Michael Burry Says He’s Not Short Tesla Shares
content.summary: “I am not short,” Burry said in response to a user on X who asked if he would bet against Tesla.  The renowned investor earned his reputation for predicting the collapse of the US housing market before the 2008 financial crisis.  Since slumping in April, when Elon Musk’s political antics sparked fears that his interest in running the carmaker may be waning, Tesla shares have staged a spectacular turnaround and are near an all-time high.

headline: These Stocks Are the Market’s Biggest Winners and Losers in 2025
summary: The AI trade broadened out this year, as chip stocks again led the S&P 500 but were joined by the shares of companies tied to building the data centers that will power the technology.  Three of the index’s top 10 performers in 2025 were data storage companies, which are among the main beneficiaries of the hundreds of billions of dollars in pledged spending by the giant AI cloud service providers known as hyperscalers.

content.title: These Stocks Are the Market’s Biggest Winners and Losers in 2025
content.summary: The AI trade broadened out this year, as chip stocks again led the S&P 500 but were joined by the shares of companies tied to building the data centers that will power the technology.  Three of the index’s top 10 performers in 2025 were data storage companies, which are among the main beneficiaries of the hundreds of billions of dollars in pledged spending by the giant AI cloud service providers known as hyperscalers.

headline: Electric Vehicles Today - Revoltz Unveils Eco-Friendly Urban Delivery Vehicle Innovation
summary: Charging Robotics Inc.'s subsidiary, Revoltz Ltd., has made strides in the electric vehicle sector by successfully demonstrating its PORTO electric micro-mobility vehicle to Israeli government officials. The PORTO, a compact, three-wheeled electric cargo vehicle designed for last-mile logistics, has the potential to enhance urban delivery operations with its significant cargo capacity and full-day operational range on a single charge. The zero-emission vehicle is aimed to streamline urban...

headline: Trump Media in crypto, Michael Burry's Tesla call, Nike CEO
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are set to end 2025 in the green, marking the third year of double-digit gains. Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Michel Burry's latest Tesla (TSLA) call, Trump Media & Technology Group's (DJT, DJTWW) crypto offerings, and Nike (NKE) stock's gains. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Burry calls Tesla ’ridiculously overvalued’ but avoids shorting ’dangerous’ stock
summary: Investing.com -- Michael Burry, the contrarian investor famous for his "Big Short" bet against the 2008 housing bubble, clarified on Wednesday that he does not currently hold a short position in Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA), even as the electric vehicle maker braces for a challenging end to 2025. Responding to a direct inquiry on social media platform X, Burry stated, "I am not short." The clarification comes just a day after Burry used his Substack to deliver a scathing critique of the company’s val
